Alan,
I agree that it looks later than the time of the "real" Soten.  I'll speculate that the quality of the material and the workmanship were sufficient for them to accept it as "of the school."  I'll ask about it when I get a chance.  

I happened to just look at this: http://www.nihonto.com/rh336.html and http://www.nihonto.com/rh338.html
where the kanteisho say mumei Hikone.  But of course the shakudo one is signed.
Jim



  Matt, Jim,
  Thanks Matt, the figures and inlay are Soten style but the shape!!! I did
  not think the Soten group worked as late as this tsuba appears to be, I have
  not seen one like it before, ideas Jim?
  Alan
